collide.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you
collide.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
Two trains collided head-on  (=when they were moving directly towards each other).
I ran around the corner, and almost collided with Mrs Laurence.
collide.translation[0].definitions[0].no: In everyday English, people usually say run into rather than collide with:
Her car ran into the back of a truck.
collide.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to disagree strongly with a person or group, especially on a particular subject
collide.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The president has again collided with Congress over his budget plans.
collide.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if two very different ideas, ways of thinking etc collide, they come together and produce an interesting result
collide.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Istanbul, where East and West collide.
